hu.trigary.iodine.api.gui

Interface IodineRoot<T extends IodineRoot<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the class implementing this interface
    All Superinterfaces:
    AttachmentHolder<T>, GuiParent<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IodineGui, IodineOverlay

    public interface IodineRoot<T extends IodineRoot<T>>
extends GuiParent<T>, AttachmentHolder<T>
    Represents a IodineGui or a IodineOverlay. Instances of this class are the top-level roots of GUIs/overlays.

      • makeChild

        @NotNull
<E extends GuiElement<E>> E makeChild(@NotNull
                                               E element,
                                               int x,
                                               int y)
        Makes the specified element a direct child of this instance. If the element is already a child it is moved to the new position if necessary.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the element
        Parameters:
        element - the element to add as a child
        x - the X component of the element's render position
        y - the Y component of the element's render position
        Returns:
        the new child (for chaining)

      • addElement

        @NotNull
<E extends GuiElement<E>> T addElement(@NotNull
                                                @NotNull java.lang.Object id,
                                                @NotNull
                                                @NotNull GuiElements<E> type,
                                                int x,
                                                int y,
                                                @NotNull
                                                @NotNull java.util.function.Consumer<E> initializer)
        Adds a new element of the specified type to this instance. The parent of the element will be this instance. The initializer function atomically initializes the new element. The element will be accessible using the specified ID. This ID must be unique. If ID-based access is not required, then optionally addElement(GuiElements, int, int, Consumer) can be used instead.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the element to add
        Parameters:
        id - id the identifier of the element which can be used later to retrieve it
        type - the class of the element to add
        initializer - the function which atomically initializes the element
        x - the X component of the element's render position
        y - the Y component of the element's render position
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • addElement

        @NotNull
default <E extends GuiElement<E>> T addElement(@NotNull
                                                        @NotNull GuiElements<E> type,
                                                        int x,
                                                        int y,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        @NotNull java.util.function.Consumer<E> initializer)
        Adds a new element of the specified type to this instance. Same as calling addElement(Object, GuiElements, int, int, Consumer) with new Object() as the ID.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the element to add
        Parameters:
        type - the class of the element to add
        initializer - the function which atomically initializes the element
        x - the X component of the element's render position
        y - the Y component of the element's render position
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • addElement

        @NotNull
default <E extends GuiElement<E>> T addElement(@NotNull
                                                        @NotNull java.lang.Object id,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        @NotNull GuiElements<E> type,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        @NotNull java.util.function.Consumer<E> initializer)
        Adds a new element of the specified type to this instance. Same as calling addElement(Object, GuiElements, int, int, Consumer) with 0;0 as the X;Y positions.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the element to add
        Parameters:
        id - id the identifier of the element which can be used later to retrieve it
        type - the class of the element to add
        initializer - the function which atomically initializes the element
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • removeElement

        @NotNull
T removeElement(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.lang.Object id)
        Deletes the element with the specified ID from this instance. If no element is found with that ID, then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the element
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • removeElement

        T removeElement(@NotNull
                @NotNull GuiElement<?> element)
        Deletes the specified element from this instance. If the element is not part of this instance, then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to remove
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • atomicUpdate

        @NotNull
T atomicUpdate(@NotNull
                        @NotNull java.util.function.Consumer<T> updater)
        Runs the specified callback, executing all updates atomically. This means that the instance won't be updated for the players until the callback has returned. This way the players can't observe intermediate states, only start and result states.
        Parameters:
        updater - the callback that updates this instance
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • openFor

        @NotNull
T openFor(@NotNull
                   @NotNull IodinePlayer player)
        Opens this instance for the specified player. This method will do nothing if this instance is already opened for the player. If the player has a instance opened that it is not this one, then that instance will be closed. This operation is only valid for modded players.
        Parameters:
        player - the target player
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)

      • closeFor

        @NotNull
T closeFor(@NotNull
                    @NotNull IodinePlayer player)
        Closes this instance for the specified player. This method will do nothing if this instance is not opened for the player.
        Parameters:
        player - the target player
        Returns:
        the current instance (for chaining)
